review_blob: Great, smooth stout with a cream colored head. Almost as good as Guiness, although it has a strange, lingering aftertaste.
A very well-designed label. Its a crisp amber-colored beer with just the right amount of hops.
Very strong chocolate taste without being as thick as Youngs. A rich aftertaste and even better with ice cream.
Hints of chocolate and coffee, with a very smooth, malty finish. Arguably better than Sams Black Lager.
A very slight pomegranate taste, and light enough to drink with dinner. Nothing special.
beer_name: Fort Collins Major Toms Pomegranate Wheat

review_blob: Its a dark, hoppy porter that has a hint of chocolate. I got it on tap at a local tavern, but the packaging on the bottles is really awesome.

This is the first beer Ive had from the Church, and it is a really great starter. Its light and crisp. 

Im not a huge fan of the label, however... too many breweries use the Algerian font.

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: I had never seen this type of product before, but I really did enjoy this dark ale. It is definitely an autumnal drink, with hints of spice and hops. Reminded me a stronger #9, without the apricot.
A great tasting, thick stout that looks more like an Americano or espresso than beer. A hint of chocolate and hops.
